ThingDef.label: alligator
ThingDef.description: The alligator is a large reptile that inhabits freshwater wetlands. They are apex predators and consume fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals. Like other crocodilians, healthy alligators may continue to grow throughout their lives.

ThingDef.label: alligator egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized alligator egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into an alligator. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: badger
ThingDef.description: Badgers are small nocturnal mammals with flat, wedge-shaped bodies, broad feet with long claws and coarse hair. Badgers have strong limbs and sharp claws that help them dig burrows and find food underground. They are omnivorous, with a diet consisting largely of earthworms, insects, grubs and small animals such as hedgehogs and rabbits.

ThingDef.label: black bear
ThingDef.description: A medium sized omnivorous mammal adapted for cold climates. Bears' thick blubber and fur keeps them warm in winter.\n\nWhile their usual diet consists of fish, berries, honey, and scavenged meat, the black bear is capable of using its massive strength and deadly claws to kill live prey. They are startlingly quick for such lumbering creatures.

ThingDef.label: camel
ThingDef.description: A large land mammal adapted to arid environments. Domesticated since ancient times, its wool and leather are both exceptionally good at insulating against the desert heat, and its milk is quite nourishing. It can be used as a pack animal, but two humps make it extremely uncomfortable to ride.\n\nBy storing water in its large humps and reclaiming moisture from its breath as it exhales, it can go weeks without drinking.

ThingDef.label: british shorthair cat
ThingDef.description: A pedigreed version of a regular british cat, with a distinctively chunky body, dense coat and a very broad face. While being relatively powerful-looking due to the large chest and massive paws, these cats are absolutely harmless.

ThingDef.label: hedgehog
ThingDef.description: Hedgehogs are diminutive mammals with cone-shaped faces, short legs and bodies that are covered with porcupine-like quills. When in danger, the hedgehog rolls into a ball so that the quills cover the entire area of their exposed body and protects the animal from predators.

ThingDef.label: crocodile
ThingDef.description: A large semi-aquatic reptile, most often found on the river banks. It's predatory insticts combined with an extremely strong jaw allow them to tackle much larger prey. Older crocodiles can grow to monstrous sizes.

ThingDef.label: crocodile egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized crocodile egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: crocodile egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized crocodile egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a crocodile. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: giraffe
ThingDef.description: A giraffe is one of the tallest mammals in the galaxy, using it's long neck to reach leaves and branches unavailable for smaller herbivores.

ThingDef.label: gorilla
ThingDef.description: These ground-dwelling herbivorous apes are the largest living primates, and they are the next closest living relatives to humans after the chimpanzees and bonobos. Like all the great apes, the arms of the gorilla are longer than its legs. Gorillas are usually surprisingly shy, though they may show aggression by beating their chests and charging if their social group is threatened.

ThingDef.label: desert tortoise
ThingDef.description: This heavily armored desert-dwelling reptile is known for its slow moving speed and extremely hard, flat domed shell, making it tough to kill. Desert tortoises, despite their small size, are great combat animals and are relatively easy to tame.

ThingDef.label: desert tortoise egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized desert tortoise egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: desert tortoise egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized desert tortoise egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby desert tortoise. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: hippopotamus
ThingDef.description: A massive semi-aquatic hoofed mammal with thick skin and a very powerful jaw.\n\nExtremely difficult to tame, these monstrous beings often attack on a failed attempt.

ThingDef.label: hippopotamus leather
ThingDef.description: A thick leather of a hippopotamus. Not only it's extremely durable, but it also provides considerable heat insulation.

ThingDef.label: hyena
ThingDef.description: A large dog-like carnivore most often found in the shrublands and deserts. A common trope in tribal legends, the laughter produced by these animals can sow fear during the long desert nights.

ThingDef.label: jaguar
ThingDef.description: A large felid species and the only existing member of the Panthera native to the Americas in old Earth. This spotted cat closely resembles the leopard, but is usually larger and sturdier. The jaguar enjoys swimming and is largely a solitary, opportunistic, stalk-and-ambush predator at the top of the food chain.

ThingDef.label: kangaroo
ThingDef.description: Kangaroo is a large, human-sized marsupial with strong legs and powerful arms. It's favoured by tribal hunters due to its tender meat and heat resistant leather. Kangaroos make for powerful adversaries in melee combat, and can be trained easily to become animal super-soldiers.

ThingDef.label: koala
ThingDef.description: Koalas are easily recognizable for their stout body and large, round heads with fluffy ears. They typically inhabit arid and temperate woodlands, but can rarely be seen in tropical areas. Favoured by royal families, koalas are great household animals due to their wonderful nuzzling effect.

ThingDef.label: lemur
ThingDef.description: A small primate, lemurs are arboreal, and usually nocturnal. They have a pointed snout, large eyes, and a long tail. Although they are social creatures, they have traditionally been regarded as being less intelligent than other primates, since they don't exhibit behaviours of tool use in the wild.

ThingDef.label: lion
ThingDef.description: A king of the animal kingdom, a lion is a muscular, deep-chested cat with a short head and a prominent mane. Being the biggest of the cat species, lions are excellent combat animals despite their wildness.

ThingDef.label: lion pelt
ThingDef.description: A strong, luxurious leather of the leader of the animal kingdom. Often sought after by urbworld philanthropists.

ThingDef.label: megascorpion
ThingDef.description: A giant, genetically-engineered scorpion. Once created as a perfect assassination tool, it is not often seen returning to it's natural habitat - desert. A very potent poison in it's stinger helps it in tacking even much bigger prey. A eusocial creature, it cannot reproduce individually.

ThingDef.label: moose
ThingDef.description: The largest and heaviest member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates. Can easily be identified due to the size of the antlers and long, thin legs. Cannot carry packs, but domesticated moose can be milked. Unlike most other deer species, moose do not form herds and are solitary animals. Although generally slow-moving and sedentary, moose can become aggressive and move quickly if angered or startled.

ThingDef.label: pallas cat
ThingDef.description: A stout felid the size of the normal domestic cat, but much more wild. Adapted to hiding in rocky crevices in its native steppes, this led to it being popular as a vermin exterminator in the various nooks and crannies of spaceships.

ThingDef.label: pug
ThingDef.description: A small dog with physically distinctive features of a wrinkly, short-muzzled face, and curled tail. They are known for being extremely social and friendly, however due to years of genetic alterations they have a very short lifespan. Whatever life they have, they will always cheer up people around them.

ThingDef.label: seal
ThingDef.description: A medium sized semi-aquatic mammal, which only comes ashore to eat, mate and escape from predators. Being an aggresive hunter, seals are capable of tackling much bigger prey and are known for cannibalism if the food is scarce.

ThingDef.label: tiger
ThingDef.description: The tiger is the largest species among the big cats. It is most recognisable for its dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. It is an apex predator, territorial and generally solitary. In the wild, tigers mostly feed on large and medium-sized mammals.

ThingDef.label: tiger leather
ThingDef.description: Tigers were often the target of poachers in old Earth due to their luxurious pelts, a fact that almost drove them to extinction. With the near lawlessness of the Rim, tiger leather is seen as another exotic commodity to trade between settlements.

ThingDef.label: walrus
ThingDef.description: A large marine animal only found in the arctic regions of the planet, a walrus has prominent tusks which are a valuable luxury good across the planet.

ThingDef.label: pinniped leather
ThingDef.description: Tanned and dried leather from a Pinniped. It is of average strength but insulates well against heat.

ThingDef.label: walrus tusk
ThingDef.description: A walrus's tusk. It is quite valuable, but somewhat unwieldy as a melee weapon.

ThingDef.label: wildebeest
ThingDef.description: Also called Gnu, this wild cow earned it's name with it's menacing horns, pointed beard and large head. These animals are known from their migrations and the size of their herds.\n\nDue to its wildness, it produces milk at much slower rate than a standard cow.

ThingDef.label: wildebeest pelt
ThingDef.description: A thick but crumbly wildebeest fur and leather. Whilst it provides some degree of damage protection, the overall longevity of the item decreases.

ThingDef.label: zebra
ThingDef.description: A member of the horse family native to arid and desert areas. Whilst it doesn't share the same bodysize as a horse, due to years of evolution it's one of the fastest hooved animals.
